titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Maud Aura Mackey (1872-1957) was educated at Occidental College and Los Angeles Medical College. In 1899, Mackey was appointed by the Board of Foreign Missions to work in Paoting, China. She went for language training to Peking. Shortly after her arrival in Peking, the Boxer Uprising took the lives of many of the missionaries and Chinese church members in Paoting. When Hodge Memorial Hospital was built in Paoting, she returned there and most of the remainder of her service was performed there. She retired in Los Angeles in 1942.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of eight black and white glass slides. Included are images of Chinese workers, a group of Chinese men studying, Mr. and Mrs. Steinbeck, and Mr. and Mrs. Jenness. The collection also includes a letter from Maud Mackey to Mrs. Culver, dated 1929.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
